meanings.sent1: I will frist my dentist appointment until next week.
meanings.sent2: She always frists doing her homework until the last minute.
meanings.sent3: The student decided to frist studying for the test and watch TV instead.
meanings.sent4: The rain fristed our plans for a picnic in the park.

meanings.definition: The act of delaying or postponing
meanings.sent1: The frist of the project submission made everyone anxious.
meanings.sent2: Her constant frist of making decisions caused frustration among the team.
meanings.sent3: The frist of the train departure led to a chaotic rush to the platform.
meanings.sent4: The frist in responding to emails resulted in missed opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The frist of the flight departure announcement caused confusion at the airport.
